did.unittitle: Alexander C. Tompkins military appointment and certificate
did.abstract: This collection includes a document appointing Alexander C. Tompkins as a Private in the Westchester County-based 17th Regiment of the New York State Militia, dated 1864, and a certificate recognizing Tompkins as a contributor to the erection of the Washington Monument in Washington, D.C., circa 1880.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mrs. George M. Welch, 1944.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The two items in this collection are housed in one folder with no particular arrangement.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Alexander C. Tompkins military appointment and certificate, 1977.394, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level. Rehoused and finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in October 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes a document appointing Alexander C. Tompkins as a Private in the Westchester County-based 17th Regiment of the New York State Militia, dated 1864, and a certificate recognizing Tompkins as a contributor to the erection of the Washington Monument in Washington, D.C., circa 1880.
